scenario:
Fiserv, Inc. reported fourth-quarter 2024 results, beating analyst consensus estimates for revenue and adjusted EPS. The company reported revenue of $5.25 billion and adjusted EPS of $2.51, exceeding estimates of $4.96 billion and $2.48 respectively. 

Fiserv expects FY25 organic revenue growth of 10%-12% and adjusted EPS outlook of $10.10-$10.30, representing growth of 15%-17% Y/Y. Analysts have raised price forecasts, with Stephens, Keefe, Bruyette & Woods, KeyBanc, and RBC Capital Markets analysts increasing their targets to $270, $260, $270, $270, and $270 respectively. 

Analysts expect Fiserv to experience healthy business trends, with volume growth in line with Visa and Mastercard across SMB and Enterprise segments. Distribution expansion and new product rollouts are strengthening Clover, while upcoming new client wins in 2025 should drive further growth in Financial Solutions. 

KeyBanc analyst Alex Markgraff raised FY25/FY26 estimates, driven primarily by stronger Merchant Solutions growth and margin expansion. RBC Capital Markets analyst Daniel R. Perlin adjusted FY25 revenue estimate to $20.5 billion while maintaining the adjusted EPS estimate at $10.20. 

Fiserv's stock is up 0.48% at $230.64. Investors can gain exposure to the stock via TCW Compounders ETF GRW and Global X FinTech ETF FINX.
